name: GetBroadcastLinkMetrics
description:
Retrieve metrics for link clicks in a broadcast.

This tool returns metrics for link clicks within a specified broadcast, providing both total counts and series data over defined periods such as days or weeks. Useful for analyzing broadcast performance.

parameters.name: broadcast_identifier
parameters.description: The numeric identifier of the broadcast for which link metrics are needed.

parameters.name: report_period
parameters.description: Defines the unit of time for the report. Options are 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', or 'months'.

value_schema.description: The unit of time for your report.

parameters.name: period_steps
parameters.description: Specify the number of time periods to return. Defaults to the maximum or 12 if the period is 'months'. Max: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

value_schema.description: The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

parameters.name: return_unique_customer_results
parameters.description: Set to true to return only unique customer results, ensuring each customer is counted once regardless of clicks.

value_schema.description: If true, the response contains only unique customer results, i.e. a customer who clicks a link twice is only counted once. If false, the response contains the total number of results without regard to uniqueness.
